availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Prather Linthicum (Nelson County attorney and politician)

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Kentucky native. Attended St. Joseph’s College. Married to Elizabeth Malone. Father of [Unknown] Linthicum. Store clerk. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1837. County attorney of Nelson County. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1848 to 1851. Nelson County commissioner. Judge of the County Court of Nelson County. President of the Louisville and Bardstown Turnpike. Attorney in Nelson County in 1860. Deacon of the Bardstown Baptist Church.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 173.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, Bardstown, p.78A.
Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Covington, KY: Collins & Co., 1882), p. 645.
The Biographical Encyclopædia of Kentucky of the Dead and Living Men of the Nineteenth Century, vol. 1 (Cincinnati: J. M. Armstrong & Company, 1878), 581-82.
